Catalog_Raisonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 79; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 192 no. 298, p. 303.
artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kakumotoya Kinjirō; Carver: Katada Chōjirō
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
dimension: 14 1/4 × 9 7/8 in. (36.2 × 25.08 cm) (image, sheet, each; vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳桐 {Yoshikiri} | Carver’s seal: 深川彫長 {Fukagawa hori Chō} | Censor seal: 戌五改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
text: Related to the play Shōbu awase adachi kōdan 菖蒲合仇討講談, performed at the Ichimura Theater in the 5th month of 1862.
title: Actors Iwai Kumesaburō III as Oyone (R), Kawarazaki Gonjūrō I as Taheiji (C), and Nakamura Shikan IV as Magoshichi (L)
